WorkItem.ClosedComment: It is indeed not a keyword... We've decided not to change the behavior at this time.
WorkItem.Description:
Is there a reason for this?

It comes up with the keyword icon in Intellisense, but it's drawn with the default text color instead of my keyword color. 

I know undefined is technically a variable defined at the global scope...but why then does it have the keyword icon in the Intellisense dialog? Can "undefined" be elevated to full keyword status in TypeScript?

Comments.Message: Thanks for reporting this. Marking as active, which means we're taking a look at fixing this.
